intro: Passovia alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf pellitory, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its alternate arrangement of leaves along the stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually white or pale blue in color. Passovia alternifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
